utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Now to a bombshell that could impact next month's special election for Jeff Sessions' old senate seat in Alabama. Some very serious new allegations against Republican nominee Roy Moore. Details from now from Peter Doocy who's live in Washington. Peter?

utterances.speaker: PETER DOOCY, FOX NEWS
utterances.sentences: Kimberly, a 53-year-old woman claims that when she was 14, and Roy Moore was just 32 -- he's 70 now, long before he became famous for getting kicked off the Alabama Supreme Court for leaving a 10 Commandment statue up. Moore kissed her, he touched her, he stripped down, he tried to get her to touch him in a sexual way, and she said she didn't want it. But tonight, Moore is not admitting to anything. He's calling this fake news. And part of an email statements from the campaign said this, Judge Roy Moore has endured the most outlandish attack on any candidate in the modern political arena. But this story is base Washington Post, alleging sexual impropriety takes the cake. National liberal organizations know their chosen candidate, Doug Jones, is in a death spiral and this is their last ditch Hail Mary. The senate majority leader, Mitch McConnell, who Moore basically ran against in his primary, just said this, if these allegations are true, he must step aside. But not all Republicans have the patience to wait to see how this pans out. Senator John McCain says this about Moore, quote, he should immediately step aside and allow the people of Alabama to elect a candidate they can be proud of. But even if Moore does step aside, his name is still going to be on the ballot in December because we're within 76 days, and the law says the ballot can't be reprinted this late. Alabama also has something called a sore loser law, which means that since Luther Strange already lost this year, he can't run on the ballot as an independent. But he could stage a write-in campaign. Tonight, Strange hasn't said anything about a writing campaign. All he said is that the details he knows are very disturbing. Kimberly?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. Peter, thank you for that report. So Dana, it's quite a development in a race that was heated to begin with. There's a little bit fractured in terms of Republican support with the president supporting Strange. And a bunch of other Republican, populist, Bannon, whatnot, supporting Roy Moore. This is a guy who's not gone out, you know, without a fight before when they wanted to remove him, he wouldn't resign. And now we have this situation, obviously, a very disturbing allegation. And if true, then there's no place for him on the ticket.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So the Washington Post has four on the record sources. And to call it fake news, I mean, that would be extraordinary that you had four different people all lying about somebody. These are actually Republicans, the ones that were quoted. At least the one main one is. Obviously, it's disturbing. But I have to say this, the state auditor of Alabama, the way he tried to spin this is to say take Joseph and Mary. Mary was a teenager. Joseph was an adult carpenter. They became parents of Jesus, right? As Greg pointed out, actually, Jesus was Immaculate Conception.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I remember that part.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That doesn't make sense.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And I think that if you are worried about speaking up about this because you might get political ammunition to your opposing side, that that is weak and wrong.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK. Greg Gutfeld, what do you make of the situation? And give us a prediction.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, I will go on record and say that I'm against adult men hitting on 14-year-old girls. OK?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Good man.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Thank you for that. But it seems like it's raining bad men. You know, to paraphrase that classic song.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Raining Weinsteins?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. It seems like another hour there's another tawdry tale. And what's happening now may be a form of justice, but there seems to be missing a process. Like, what do you -- what's next now? Does -- does the guy just step down and go away? Or is there some kind of investigation?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Due process, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, I -- it depends on what are you looking for.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I mean Trump. In terms of...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: From a conservative ideology, Luther Strange was much more pure.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, but I'm talking in the...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: In the new version of populism.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: In the new ideology. Yes. In the new -- we've replaced one ideology with another.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Right. GUTFELD; Is what I'm saying.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You mean that the -- he was more about Steve Bannon guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, right. And so that made you blind.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Luther Strange was much more a Mitch McConnell guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And now -- and Bannon, in fact, just said yesterday, "Get McConnell out of here" and all that. But this is Steve Bannon's guy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's -- my point is when you choose an ideology, which is like this is how it's going to be, you often -- you don't really do as much research as you should, because you're blinded by your own biases.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: OK, so also, Jesse, you have McConnell speaking out, saying if these allegations are true, he must step aside. So you've already got division, you know, in the party. How do you see this playing out and how quickly?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't see how this plays out.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Luther could be a write-in.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Politics is a dirty business. And you know, innocent until proven guilty, but this doesn't seem like that to me. I'm just not getting that feeling. So I think he should step down, do the decent thing. But I mean, to your point about the politics of this, I shouldn't even say it, but I mean, the Democrats obviously are going to capitalize on it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I just don't -- I don't know where it goes. You know, I'm assuming that The Washington Post will have a follow-up story, and if Roy Moore has evidence that this is, indeed, fake news, that he should come forward with it, all of it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, usually with these stories, another story encourages other people to talk.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Which is why it's raining bad men.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Hate when that happens. Coming up, Greg exposes the truth about some race-related hoaxes coming up next. Stay with us.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Now on to some lighter news: A few months back, we ran a clip of a superintendent at the Air Force Academy chastising racist cadets. His speech came after slurs were found on a dorm room message board belonging to black students.

utterances.speaker: LT. GEN. JAY SILVERIA, AIR FORCE ACADEMY SUPERINTENDENT
utterances.sentences: If you demean someone in any way, then you need to get out. And if you can't treat someone from another race or a different color skin with dignity and respect, then you need to get out. The power of that diversity comes together and makes us that much more powerful.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, like many in the media, we ran this clip because it provided a powerful response to racism that the media demanded after Charlottesville. While the clip ran, I kept shaking my head for I'd seen this story before. The list of hate crimes hoaxes is long. Now we must add this one to the tally. According to The Air Force Times, a black cadet admitted to writing the slurs and he's since left the school. So what's the response when we see stories like these exposed as hoaxes? It's never as huge as the initial response was when we assumed that it was real -- which only encourages more hoaxes, for the outrage over the crime is the only part the press seems to remember, not its debunking, which encourages the copycats. Which is why we're doing this now: So people don't keep thinking this kind of thing pays off. Of course, social justice warriors will repeat the pathetic excuse that, while this racist act may not be true here, you just know it's true somewhere else. Which guarantees further opportunity for attention and likely another student's expulsion. I know it's crazy, but maybe it's time we stop feeding the stories to the public before they're properly investigated. Who am I kidding? All right, Juan, I think you owe me a steak dinner, because I remember after we did this, I said to you, "This isn't real."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You did say that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You guys are making dinner bets on hate crimes?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's because we're so compassionate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think -- well, I first -- my head was...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You shake your head, but you have this thing where you're just like...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm going, "This is not true. This is not true." And then afterwards, I go, "Juan, steak dinner. I'm betting."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: By the way, it's not good for you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's not good for you, yes. I was going nuts.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think we'll give you fish.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't eat fish. You know that. So what do you -- when you see this, this obviously puts race relations back. Because it makes everybody suspicious of accusations now, right?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Sure. But you know, I think the reason that you're doing this is that you think that this means that all allegations are somehow fraught. I don't think that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You're using that social justice...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm asking.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I'm saying I told you so, Juan. That's why I'm doing it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: In this case, you tell me so, and there are other cases, because as you were speaking, as you were building the monologue, I think the viewers can see...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: There's a lot.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: ... there's a list of people. But my -- my feeling about this is, look, if you ever look at my -- or at the Twitter account for this show while I'm on, you will know that there are some pretty harsh feelings...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Don't look at it, Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Most of those, though, are from Kilmeade. So -- Kilmeade's got a lot of dummy accounts.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, now that Twitter's 280, it's really bad.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He spends a lot of time on it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's a terrible person. He gets up so early, and then he just goes on after Juan. Kimberly, is there some kind of punishment that -- is, like the punishment so -- a lot of times when people do these fake hoaxes, if they say they're under psychological stress, they need therapy. Should there be stiffer penalties for this stuff?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I mean, you would think so, right? Because when you see kind of the cumulative effect and the collateral damage that results from things like this, it's really bad. Remember, "Hands up. Don't shoot"? It really stimulates in a very negative way, you know, racial divide and injustice and crimes that are committed against individuals, personal and property damage. Really hurting communities. And it's so far along after, sometimes when you find out that this wasn't true, that if you didn't sort of search for it to follow up on it, you wouldn't know. And that's why I think you did a great job...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: ... on this one thing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That you actually bring it up and you follow up and you track it down and say, "Remember this? When I was like, 'Hey, this wasn't true.'"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. I knew it was going to happen. Another hate crime that was exposed as a hoax, it was, Dana, a Kansas State student wrote slurs on his car. And it turned out it was the victim, a black male, who had written it. And so, when you hear the initial...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Did he have to leave the school?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I didn't read that far.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He wasn't in the school.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: When it comes to this person from the Air Force Academy...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, he's gone.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: ... the punishment is that he just missed out on a wonderful educational opportunity.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right, yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And so...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Does he deserve a second chance?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You don't think so?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm not -- but I also think that this should not take away from what I think was a pretty amazing display of leadership on behalf of Jay Silveria, the lieutenant general who addresses the students immediately, takes immediate action with a pretty powerful speech.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Why? Are you going to take away from that?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Why.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't know. I just am. Because I knew it was fake. And you know what, I can't...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But he didn't know it was fake, and he felt like he had to do something immediately.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Or was he trying to make -- cover his...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Are you questioning the lieutenant general?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I question everything. I question you right now, Dana. I don't even know who you are anymore. Jesse, thoughts?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Thoughts, yes. Well, I think Kimberly's favorite poet, Shakespeare, said a lie travels halfway around the world before truth puts its shoes on.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't think Shakespeare said that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Is that a hoax?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think it was Jim Fix (ph). I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Either way, this happens. And this guy researching this says there's hundreds of these per year. We just had one in New York where a Muslim woman said, "Two white guys on the subway attacked me and tried to rip off my hijab."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: She had a...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ended up filing a fake police report. Now, the motivation for this is because people are struggling with personal problems, and they want to feel, as the victim...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Important.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And they want the attention that the victim and victimhood gets. And the victimology industry is an incubator for these fake hate crimes, and they're mostly on college campuses, where you have these safe spaces, the micro aggressions, and everybody hates the straight white male. So when these people get to college, their antennas go up, and they're always looking for sexism and homophobia and racism. And then, when nothing happens, they are forced to make them up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Instead of being a victim, be a victor. There's a T-shirt for you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That was Shakespeare, too.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That was Shakespeare, too. Maybe it was. I don't know. Maybe it was Shakespeare. I don't think it was.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We'll find out in the commercial break.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. A new twist in the violent attack on Kentucky Senator Rand Paul, next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Early reports were Senator Rand Paul was assaulted by neighbor Rene Boucher because of a landscaping disagreement. That resulted in six broken ribs and fluid around the lungs for Senator Paul. But now the senator suggests the landscaping dispute claim is erroneous, and a statement from his senior advisors, Doug Stafford, says, quote, "This was not a fight. It was a blindside, violent attack by a disturbed person. Anyone claiming otherwise is uninformed or seeking media attention." Senator Paul's neighbor has pleaded not guilty, but sources say Senator Paul has been told to expect federal charges against his attacker. What's the federal charges? Is it because he's a senator?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes, and so here's the thing. So when you have an investigation like this being conducted by the FBI, you're not supposed to talk about it. He shouldn't be making any statement, because this is a very serious matter. He was injured in a horrific way. He was attacked by a psycho coward who blindsided him and severely injured him. So it's a bad situation. And when people say, "Oh, he's not issuing a statement." I mean, to suggest, like -- can you imagine if this was a liberal Democrat and somebody came and attacked him at his house and broke his ribs and fluid in the lungs and the whole deal? No. It would be a completely different way that this would be handled. And for them to try to say it was about bushes or foliage or whatever, it's just absolutely ridiculous. I see this in the same way that I saw the attacks on the baseball game where, you know, Scalise was injured. This appears to be that somebody who's well-documented -- well-documented -- on his Facebook page as somebody who is very much against President Trump, wants impeachment, is very liberal in his ideology and committed a crime specifically, I believe, against Rand Paul because of those ideals.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It did seem a bit bizarre that the statements coming out initially were about rules and regulations in the neighborhood about what you can plant and what you can't plant. Like pumpkins are not allowed or something like that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I don't -- I can't -- I don't know what to make of this. I mean, it's interesting how, you know, the closer you are to somebody, the more likely you don't like them. It's like -- it's like, why do anchors hate each other on shows when they only see each other an hour a day? You know what I mean? It's like these neighbors -- they always say good fences make good neighbors. Maybe they didn't have good fences. But there might be...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You can't excuse this guy's behavior. It's completely...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm not saying that. I'm just saying there's something else going on here that we don't know about. And what would make me so angry to attack somebody and just -- we assume -- we keep saying he's unstable. We don't know if he's unstable. But what would make me angry to attack -- to go and attack a neighbor, that's what you should be asking yourself. We'll be right back.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Jesse, what do you think? Will we ever really no?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Typical liberal, always blaming the bushes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Aaa! Well done! Well done.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I knew Gutfeld would have liked that one. Just like Gutfeld, I sniffed this out. When I heard the guy's name was Rene Boucher, I was like guilty as charged.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, really?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Also, here's the deal. CNN put this thing out from the beginning. They did a report immediately afterwards that talked to a few anonymous neighbors that blamed the landscaping. No one was on the record blaming landscaping. And then the Washington Examiner came out with seven on-the-record neighbors saying this guy had nothing to do with the bushes. It was all political. And then the real story got out. And they also bought, the media, the defense attorney's lying about this just being about landscaping. When have the media ever bought a line from a defense attorney so some guy that just assaulted someone? And Kimberly's point is good. If Crying Chuck got clotheslined from behind on the New York City subway, that would be a national story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why don't do it?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: These things can be mysterious. I'm not saying this was sane (ph). But remember when Senator Reid got all -- and that never actually -- no one ever actually understood. He said he was doing exercises.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He got hit.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Fell off of a machine.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No, a rubber band thing in the bathroom.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You bought that?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, not necessarily. But Juan, I mean, is there -- do you think that we will get resolution on this?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I think you've got to. Because it's going to go to some kind of a trial. And I think it's going to go. Right now it's a misdemeanor charge. It sounds like it's going to get ramped up, because it's going to be an attack on a federal official.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: It's going to go federal.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I must say I don't see why anybody who is anti-Trump would be attacking Rand Paul.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's what I don't get.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It doesn't make sense to me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. "One More Thing" up next.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You know they talk on the phone every...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: You're so mean. You're the meanest person.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Time now for "One More Thing" -- Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Let's go to this thing, real quick.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Greg's Etiquette News.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right, this thing, it's been a kind of a gloomy news day. If this doesn't make you smile, nothing will. Check out this otter eating at a dinner table.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I don't think there's anything better on the planet then watching this otter, a domestic Asian short-clawed otter, eating with his hands at the dinner table like a normal child.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Aww.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What good manners! He has better manners than I do. Look at him with his hands. This is amazing. This is -- this animal has a soul.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This is the most uplifting part of the show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, now you know why I'm happy.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK, Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Mine is even better. Thank you so much. So take a look at this adorable video. This shows President Trump showing the Chinese president video of his granddaughter singing in Mandarin. And this is Arabella, so take a look.

utterances.speaker: ARABELLA KUSHNER, GRANDDAUGHTER OF DONALD TRUMP
utterances.sentences: (SINGING IN MANDARIN)

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Can't say that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: All right. And President Xi said that she did a terrific job and deserved an A-plus. She is 6 years old, and she is the daughter of Ivanka and Jared. She's been learning Mandarin from her Chinese nanny. Isn't that great?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Cute little hair bun. Adorable.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Cute.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And effective diplomacy.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I mean, the best.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: My turn?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. So Veterans Day is coming up on Sunday. And so veterans, pay attention, because this is a pretty good deal. There's a company called, "We Work." And they have high-tech, fully operational workplaces, and they are starting something called Veterans and Residents. So through the program, every six months for the next five years, they're going to sponsor work space for 100 veterans across ten cities. Lots of great cities on this. They have on-site counseling. They can help you get your business started. And they have also committed to hiring 1,500 veterans themselves over the next five years to support all of their business -- it's a growing company. And you can go to WeWork.com, Veterans and Residents, to learn more. I think it's a really good deal, and I would take advantage of it, vets.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: We love the vets.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So for the first four days, Obamacare enrollment through the roof. Americans registering on Tuesday. Health care proved to be one of the most important issues, as you know, in Virginia. Maine voters also strongly support expanding Medicaid under Obamacare. And now look at this. Here's Jimmy Kimmel promoting I don't know what, but he's promoting something, very -- called Trumpcare.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I just found out about Trumpcare.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I just found out about Trumpcare, too.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: My family got coverage we can afford, thanks to Trumpcare.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Trumpcare is the market-based insurance program administered by President Trump that meets his campaign promise for great affordable care.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, that's the message for politicians. Americans want good health care.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Steve Scalise still recovering from being shot. He was racing his scooter through the halls of Congress with his fellow congressman, Representative Johnson from Texas, who actually was wearing a helmet. I'm not really sure why. But we don't know who won yet. They were taking bets on the side, we have learned. But good luck, and I'm glad Steve is back. All right. "Special Report" up next.
